dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, Host_B, did you see this news? The U.S., like, actually announced they're joining an international coalition for the COVID vaccine?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, Host B, did you see this news? The U S, like, actually announced they're joining an international coalition for the C O V I D vaccine?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The U.S. announced Tuesday that it would not join an international coalition to find and distribute a Covid-19 vaccine worldwide due to the group's association with the World Health Organization, the latest sign of the Trump administration withdrawing the country from the international health community's response to the pandemic over political concerns.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: I did! Yeah, it's, um, it's a pretty big deal, isn't it? Especially considering everything that's happened before.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I did! Yeah, it's, um, it's a pretty big deal, isn't it? Especially considering everything that's happened before.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right? Like, Covax is that group trying to get vaccines distributed everywhere, globally?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? Like, Covax is that group trying to get vaccines distributed everywhere, globally?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Covax is co-led by the World Health Organization, the Coalition for Epidemic Preparedness Innovations and Gavi, which aims to purchase 2 billion doses of potential Covid-19 shots from several vaccine makers by the end of 2021 and distribute them worldwide.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. Co-led by the WHO, among others. They're aiming for, uh, two billion doses by the end of next year, worldwide. And, like, 172 countries are already talking about participating.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. Co-led by the W H O, among others. They're aiming for, uh, two billion doses by the end of next year, worldwide. And, like, one hundred seventy two countries are already talking about participating.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Covax is co-led by the World Health Organization... which aims to purchase 2 billion doses of potential Covid-19 shots from several vaccine makers by the end of 2021 and distribute them worldwide. The WHO announced last week that Covax plans to work with vaccine manufacturers to provide countries worldwide equitable access to safe and effective vaccines, once they are licensed and approved, and that 172 countries are engaged in discussions to potentially participate.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Wow. So, on the one hand, that sounds great. But I remember hearing a lot of resistance from the US government before, right? This whole "go it alone" idea?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wow. So, on the one hand, that sounds great. But I remember hearing a lot of resistance from the U S government before, right? This whole go it alone idea?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: According to the Washington Post, Health and Human Services Secretary Alex Azar had interest in exploring some type of role in Covax but there was resistance in some corners of the government and a belief that the U.S. has enough coronavirus vaccine candidates in advanced clinical trials that it can go it alone.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Totally. There was, um, definitely some internal pushback, apparently, within the administration. And, you know, this is the same administration that, uh, froze WHO funding and even threatened to pull out completely.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally. There was, um, definitely some internal pushback, apparently, within the administration. And, you know, this is the same administration that, uh, froze W H O funding and even threatened to pull out completely.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In early April, Trump blasted the World Health Organization... and froze U.S. funding to the organization. In July, the administration sent a letter signaling its intent to withdraw from the WHO.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] Which was wild, given the pandemic! So this is a pretty stark reversal, then?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which was wild, given the pandemic! So this is a pretty stark reversal, then?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Well, it's... interesting. The White House spokesman, Judd Deere, he actually said they *still* won't be constrained by "corrupt" organizations influenced by China.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, it's... interesting. The White House spokesman, Judd Deere, he actually said they still won't be constrained by corrupt organizations influenced by China.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The United States will continue to engage our international partners to ensure we defeat this virus, but we will not be constrained by multilateral organizations influenced by the corrupt World Health Organization and China, said Judd Deere, a spokesman for the White House.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Uh, okay. So it's not a *full* embrace, then. Still some lingering, like, skepticism there.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Uh, okay. So it's not a full embrace, then. Still some lingering, like, skepticism there.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, it seems so. Despite the WHO chief warning against vaccine nationalism, saying the world needs to recover together.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, it seems so. Despite the W H O chief warning against vaccine nationalism, saying the world needs to recover together.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The World Health Organization has warned against vaccine nationalism, with WHO chief Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus stating, for the world to recover faster, it has to recover together, because it's a globalized world: the economies are intertwined.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right, because, you know, economies are intertwined. It just makes sense.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, because, you know, economies are intertwined. It just makes sense.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The World Health Organization has warned against vaccine nationalism, with WHO chief Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus stating, for the world to recover faster, it has to recover together, because it's a globalized world: the economies are intertwined.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. And, um, experts were saying that if the U.S. *didn't* join, it would be a "real blow" with big political repercussions.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. And, um, experts were saying that if the U S didn't join, it would be a real blow with big political repercussions.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: When the U.S. says it is not going to participate in any sort of multilateral effort to secure vaccines, it's a real blow, said Suerie Moon, co-director of the Global Health Center at the Graduate Institute of International and Development Studies in Geneva. The behavior of countries when it comes to vaccines in this pandemic will have political repercussions beyond public health.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, that makes sense. I mean, the Swedish Prime Minister, Stefan Löfven, put it really well, actually. He said, "Equal access to a COVID-19 vaccine is the key to beating the virus."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, that makes sense. I mean, the Swedish Prime Minister, Stefan Löfven, put it really well, actually. He said, Equal access to a C O V I D-nineteen vaccine is the key to beating the virus.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Equal access to a COVID-19 vaccine is the key to beating the virus and paving the way for recovery from the pandemic, said Stefan Lfven, the prime minister of Sweden.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Totally. This can't just be a race for a few winners, right? So, this move by the U.S., even with the caveats, it's, uh, significant.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally. This can't just be a race for a few winners, right? So, this move by the U S, even with the caveats, it's, uh, significant.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: This cannot be a race with a few winners, and the COVAX Facility is an important part of the solution making sure all countries can benefit from access to the world's largest portfolio of candidates and fair and equitable distribution of vaccine doses.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Definitely. A step in a more multilateral direction, hopefully.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Definitely. A step in a more multilateral direction, hopefully.
